title: Community Care Manpower Development Award (CCMDA)
about:
CCMDA aims to support the attraction, development and retention of manpower in the Community Care sector. It covers short courses, formal academic programmes and attachments to local or overseas healthcare and Community Care facilities.
It also provides training support to General Practitioners (GPs) with a passion and desire to serve the needs of our seniors by providing medical services to clients/residents of Community Care organizations.
Its Visiting Expert scheme provides funding support for Community Care organisations to invite local and/or overseas experts with specialised areas relevant to the Community Care sector to impart their skills and share their knowledge with the local Community Care audience.
Click here for more information on CCMDA.
who_can_apply: CCMDA is open to all Community Care organisations providing elder care services. The organisations can apply for in-service staff and fresh entrants.
when_to_apply: Applications are accepted throughout the year.
funding:
CCMDA will fund up to 90% of the course fees and other relevant expenditure. The remaining 10% will be co-funded by the sponsoring/hiring organisation.
For the Visiting Expert scheme, CCMDA will fund up to 90% of fundable expenses, with the organisation co-funding the remaining expenses.
